docs.lead_paragraph: Swollen and weary in her ninth month of pregnancy, 28-year-old Lisa Bramlette sat chatting at her kitchen table while her 5-year-old son, Tyler, romped around the house in a Teen-Age Mutant Ninja Turtle outfit. Mrs. Bramlette's mother, Edith Crowell, was by her side in case labor began because Mrs. Bramlette's husband, William, was more than 1,000 miles away in Florida. "He doesn't know what's going on with me," Mrs. Bramlette said. "While he's down there working, he doesn't know if I'm in labor or if the baby's here until I call him at 9:30 each night."

headline.main: End of Jobless Benefits Pushes Many Near Despair

byline.original: By STEVEN A. HOLMES, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: It was 2:20 P.M. at the headquarters of Kirshenbaum & Bond Advertising on the fringe of SoHo, and surprisingly enough, nobody was swinging from the chandeliers. Instead, 10 copywriters, art directors and executives were crowded into a tiny conference room, debating whether a market research study adequately tested consumer reactions to a new ad. That conventional scene was significant because Kirshenbaum & Bond is not supposed to care about market research. The three-and-a-half-year-old agency built its reputation onhumorous advertising, the kind shot from the hip, not from a researcher's computer. A typical Kirshenbaum piece of work was an ad for an Italian restaurant riddled with mock bullet holes. Thriving in a Downturn Madison Avenue know-it-alls predicted that sort of advertising would eventually destroy the agency, especially as the country sank into a recession that many thought would make clients more conservative.

headline.main: Advertising 'Bad Boys' Grow Up in a Downturn

docs.lead_paragraph: IT is just the potion for a bellicose world. In some cases, it works as an aphrodisiac, inspiring males to seek females more ardently and females to invite their overtures more passionately. The hormone, which is present in humans and other mammals, helps stimulate the sensations of sexual arousal and climax. And after copulation, it acts as the proverbial cigarette, fostering a feeling of relaxed satisfaction.

headline.main: A Potent Peptide Prompts an Urge to Cuddle
